Description: Item DescriptionTitle:2005 Dean USA Custom Shop SIGNED Michael Schenker Black & White Electric GuitarDescription:Dean Guitars USA Custom Shop Michael Schenker Signature Flying V; in opposing or contrasting black/white finish with beautiful triple pinstriping. This Dean USA CS Schenker Flying V was made during the first production run and endorsement agreement; between Dean Guitars & Michael Schenker in 2005. This Dean USA CS guitar was made during the timeframe 2000-08 when Dean Zelinsky; came back to work for Dean Guitars the company he founded in the late 1970's. Dean Zelinsky had previously sold his company Dean Guitars around 1990-91 to new owners. Information perused from online guitar forums; etc. indicate that Zelinsky returned to Dean Guitars again around 2000; after selling the company some 10 years previous to work for the then owners of Dean Guitars. This Dean Michael Schenker signature guitar has a COA from Dean Guitars USA Custom Shop signed by Dean Zelinsky. The guitar is signed and numbered as well by the infamous guitar hero Michael Schenker on the headstock; and this guitar is an oddity somewhat in that this was #101 of 100 guitars made on the Dean USA CS COA. This guitar is made with a mahogany body and has the Dean V shaped neck groove with 22 like new frets; and an ebony fingerboard with mother of pearl block inlays; and all chrome hardware with Grover Tuners. The pickups are custom wound Michael Schenker humbuckers in same black/white scheme as the paint on this guitar; with 3 vol/tone knobs and a 3 way selector switch. This Dean USA CS shop Schenker was set up with a new set of GHS Boomers strings .010-.046. The guitar plays super easy and fast with the V neck; with low action and the neck relief and intonation were set proper. This Dean USA CS Schenker guitar has the matching HSC; in excellent condition done in the similar contrasting black/white finish. This Dean USA CS shop Schenker is in very nice condition; there are some minor visible scuffs in the finish. There is a small but visible slight scratch or scrape on the chrome v shaped metal piece on the topside that the strings go through. Overall though this is a very good to better described excellent condition well kept guitar; that was bought from the original owner who kept it mostly as a collectable guitar. This Dean USA CS Schenker with the COA will be well securely packed inside the HSC. Size: Not provided. Condition: See above.
